meanings.sent1: The class clown is always the annoyer during lessons.
meanings.sent2: My little brother can be quite the annoyer when he wants attention.
meanings.sent3: The annoyer in the movie kept playing pranks on everyone.
meanings.sent4: The mosquito was the annoyer of the camping trip, buzzing around all night.
meanings.sent5: The persistent door-to-door salesman was an expert annoyer.

meanings.definition: To cause irritation or annoyance to.
meanings.sent1: Loud noises can easily annoy and annoyer people.
meanings.sent2: Please don't annoyer your sister while she's studying.
meanings.sent3: The constant beeping of the alarm clock began to annoyer me.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet continued to annoyer the homeowner, keeping them awake at night.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive jingle of the ice cream truck could annoyer the entire neighborhood.
